bullets.text: U.S. JOLTS: job openings and hires little changed in November; total separations steady, signaling a cooling-but-stable labor market.
U.S. seized two oil tankers tied to Venezuela sanctions, escalating enforcement and raising shipping/insurance risks around sanctioned crude flows.
White House says Trump reserves right to use military force to secure U.S. oil interests in Venezuela, heightening geopolitical tail risk for oil markets.
Sources: Venezuela will ship sanctioned oil to the U.S. indefinitely with reduced sanctions, potentially increasing supply and pressuring global crude prices.
Oil majors say Venezuela owes billions for past investments; recovery hinges on shifting U.S. policy and Caracas stability, affecting project valuations and litigation strategies.
Trump proposes banning large institutional investors from buying single-family homes; experts doubt it materially lowers housing costs without more supply.
Trump says he will bar defense contractors from dividends and buybacks; shares fell, highlighting rising political risk around capital returns and procurement leverage.
Greenland becomes a U.S.-China strategic flashpoint over Arctic security and critical minerals; Rubio to meet Denmark, while lawmakers downplay military threats.
JPMorgan will become Apple Card issuer, ending Goldman’s consumer push; underscores retrenchment from low-margin consumer finance and stronger bank-platform tie-ups.
Alphabet’s market cap surpassed Apple’s for the first time since 2019, signaling investor rotation toward AI-driven growth and ad resilience.
Anthropic reportedly raising $10B at a $350B valuation, illustrating continued mega-round funding despite higher rates and intensifying AI compute competition.
OpenAI launched ChatGPT Health to connect medical records and wellness apps, accelerating consumer health AI while raising privacy, compliance, and liability stakes.
Google and Character.AI settlements in teen chatbot death cases may set precedents for AI safety duties, product design constraints, and litigation risk across consumer AI.
Research: wildfire pollution may be far higher than estimated, implying bigger public-health costs and strengthening the economic case for fire mitigation and air-quality policy.
Scientists built human brain circuits in the lab, a step toward better neuroscience models and drug testing—alongside significant ethical and regulatory questions.
